definitions.definition: To place on or into a physical location.
definitions.example: The statue is situated in a corner hardly visible to the public, except through a window from an outside maintenance area situated behind the building.

definitions.definition: To place or put into an intangible place or position, such as social, ethical, fictional, etc. Most commonly used adjectivally in past participle and often used figuratively.
definitions.example: The mayor is situated between probable censure and possible recall.
